website_summaries.verdict: Not as large as some other workbenches, but it has a good level of strength and portability.
pros: Inexpensive folding workbench that can be stored easily when not in use and taken to any location it's needed
on its sturdy frame that includes steel legs
After unit folds down, you can make use of a convenient carrying handle to transport it
cons: Small working surface of just 33.5 inches by 21.5 inches, so it's not designed for large tasks

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: COMPLETELY FALSE ADVERTISING !!!😡😡😡 This table is advertised as having a weight load compacity of 1000 lbs, in actually on the very first page, on the very first line, it clearly states, "DO NOT LOAD WITH MORE THAN 400lbs". That my friends is a difference of 600lbs!!!! NOT EVEN HALF!!!! Although it looks and feels sturdy, it is not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: HANS Piquion

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY BREAKABLE NON REPLACEABLE PARTS
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT idea. But the clamp retention on the bottom tray often lets the clamps pop out and become loose. No big deal. right?? Well, when the clamp comes loose while you're folding it, the clamp becomes lodged in the leg and promptly snaps it off at the hinge. No replacement parts available that I can find, and it's excluded from the warranty. I got a chance to use this table TWICE. Thanks, Keter. I therefore deem this as a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cletus Runswithscissorsguy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for several reasons.  Shop for something better.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what my GF was talking about when she said these things were good. It doesn't lock when you expand the legs (and what I mean is; you lock it in place and it keeps slipping out within a minute or two), the legs aren't level so it teeters when you give it an angry look (which you will do all the flippin' time), and when you go to use it, it shakes more than Elvis did on the Ed Sullivan show. To add insult to injury, the legs need to be overly managed when you try to collapse it for storage. Find something better to spend your money on.
customer_reviews.author: 'Cenzo

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a lemon but the one I received had a twist and would not sit level. There was a half inch gap diagonally on two corners so it wobbled so badly it was unusable. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: dfoxer

customer_reviews.title: Was really excited when I saw this on my front ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited when I saw this on my front porch. When I opened it I noticed that one of the boots on the legs was already broken. No idea how this could have happened during shipping since the legs are retracted into the body of this table. It also came missing the plastic rod bolt on the left side of the table. Perhaps it would be wise to look elsewhere for a portable workbench,
customer_reviews.author: Michael Porter

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with hole in box and side shattered.
customer_reviews.text: Come on, man! This is supposed to be a ""work"" bench (???), but it did not fair well inside a cardboard box going through shipment. Amazon personnel should know by this time that this product is defective based on all of the reviews and pictures. The plastic used in this work table is very brittle, so it cracks. I wrote an honest review, but Amazon would not allow it to be posted, even though I followed the guidelines to the tee. I'm glad I just refused the shipment because this table could be dangerous, could collapse under stress and cause injury to the user.
customer_reviews.author: Music2000

customer_reviews.title: Seriously??? Crooked company.
customer_reviews.text: Company sent damaged goods. Box was perfectly intact and no broken pieces were inside. Company actually had the nerve to knowingly send damaged goods. The edges around the top surfaces are all broken. Being that part of where you insert the clamps is around the edge, they no longer do their job for these two clamps. Just broken all around like my close up picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: Tashina

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a month, used it three times and one of the legs snapped off!
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Marginal design with several weak points, particularly at hinge points, combined with breakable plastic parts and Absolutely ZERO customer service rates this "work table" at the lower end of the available portable work tables on the market. I used this to support a miter saw - the carrying handle broke in the first week, the center support broke shortly after that, and then a leg hinge point cracked through, and the table was unlevel and shaky during its entire short life cycle. I replaced it with a Worx Pegasus that has been going strong for almost two years. You get what you pay for, but with Kater's non-existent customer support, you get less than you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioTgr

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and useless
customer_reviews.text: For as bulky as this is, it is not stable at all and not reliable as a work bench. You can set stuff on it, but doing any work on it is very questionable, as it is extremely wobbly in all directions. It came with two clamps, which is cool but one broke the first time I used it. This table became so frustrating for me to deal with that I finally just broke the whole thing and threw it in the trash. I'm happy to never use this again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Clamp broken after 7-8 uses
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I have tried to use the contact screen at the Keter website but I seem to go in circles there. One of my clamps lost the pin/rod at the rear which holds it in the track-way on the top. I have owned it just a few days under a year so, whether 2 year or 5 year warranty (there seems to be some conflicting info about that between the website and Amazon) it should still be covered. Anyone have a direct email address for Keter cust. service? EDIT: now, one of the hinged support locks underneath is broken. It is approaching being completely unusable now.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Hidden instructions make life difficult
customer_reviews.text: The item arrives in a box with no visible instructions. It's like a Chinese puzzle box. The obvious thing is to pull the legs out, which is somewhat difficult. Gradually, the puzzle reveals itself, only after much searching, wishing all the time for some instructions. Finally, when the stand seems unfolded the instructions are found hidden deep inside the most obscure place. Reading the instructions, which are excellent, the first thing to note is not to start by unfolding the legs! Why aren't the instructions available to the new owner right away??? The stand is nicely packaged in a sealed box. It would be simple to have the instructions available immediately, as is done with most consumer products.
customer_reviews.author: HOANA

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if the strength is there
customer_reviews.text: Delivered twice and both times item had crescent shape break on surface of the table's edge. Wasn't sure if its due to shipping, since there is damage to the box, but not appears to be in correlation to break or came from the factory damaged, as both breaks are similar. If this is a 1000 lb table, I'm not too impressed at the moment. Waiting for the 3rd delivery now.
customer_reviews.author: echo

customer_reviews.title: 600 pound variance
customer_reviews.text: Just received my table and was excited to use it. On Amazon it states it has 1000 pound work Pasadena on the table top, but as I was looking through the manual states do not load more than 400 pounds. 600 pound variance from what Amazon states to what the manual states is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Newt-2019

customer_reviews.title: "Do not load with more than 400lbs"
customer_reviews.text: It is advertised as being able to hold 1000lbs (also says the limit is 700lbs somewhere else in the description.) As if that's not bad enough, the first safety instruction in the manual says "Do not load with more than 400lbs (181kg)." ...so which is it? 1000lbs, 700lbs, or 400lbs? It doesn't really matter to me, the max I'll ever put on it is probably 100lbs, but what about the people who will load it up with a huge miter or press? When they add their work it could blow right through the 400lb safety limit. I've already seen people complaining about breaking legs from loading heavy work. Otherwise, this workbench looks like it will fit my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Photostefanie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found the WorX and saved myself wasting $70.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Black and Decker $150 workbench that was a "slice and dice" construction. B&D did respond but only to check if I was going to sue them for carving my hand up on the jagged sheet metal. Looks really cool. Worked great the first couple of times and then the folding end gadget broke. It did not break from any kind of use; the plastic pivot mount self destructed like it was under too much tension while it was just sitting in the garage. Impossible to repair and the fortune to return ship for warranty makes the warranty worthless. Bought a Pegasus WorkX. Wish I had found the WorX and saved myself wasting $70.
customer_reviews.author: billphoto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really gotten to use these, but when I received them, I unpackaged them and ran through unfolding/folding just to make sure there were no issues. They seem pretty sturdy, but why would you put the instructions INSIDE the stand? Specifically the instructions to UNFOLD it. So, you need to unfold it in order to read the instructions on how to unfold it. That doesn't make much sense. Other than that, seems to be a solid little work table, and folds up pretty small so it'll be easy to put out of the way when it's not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T.

customer_reviews.title: Broken Handle
customer_reviews.text: Why does this table support up to 700lbs but the handle, can't support it's on weight. The handle is poorly constructed I hung it up on the wall the handle gave way and it came crashing down. I wish I could return it. Plus you can't reattach it. Also, if you're over 5' 9" tall don't but it because you might as well use the table while working on your knees since this table is so short. So much potential but truly missed it's mark.
customer_reviews.author: Andre walton

customer_reviews.title: Quality could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: Legs donotstay folded. Top had two stripped plastic screws that sit up over top. Locked button is always up so that you do not know if top is locked. Clamps are difficult to close in order to stow them. Not sure I received a new table.
customer_reviews.author: Gcas

customer_reviews.title: I guess You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use. It seems pretty well built expect for one problem I only have one issue with this product. It seems like one leg is shorter than the rest. It is really irritating but I put a piece of 3/4 inch MDF board under the one leg and it is stable now. I did not contact the company. I threw away the packaging so I am not going to try sending it back. Not worth my time. I probably won't buy any more products from Keter after this though. :( Damn shame.....
customer_reviews.author: Billw62

customer_reviews.title: Great table, but they should tape the instructions to the outside
customer_reviews.text: The table folds up and tears down really fast. It's got a great weight rating, good height, and generally speaking I love everything about it. It's also really easy to store and move around. HOWEVER... The one thing that they did that was not great was they put the instructions right in the inside with a list of things you shouldn't do when opening the table. It was tucked away inside where the clamp storage area is, right in the center of the table. Inside were a bunch of instructions on what not to do when opening the table. Maybe tape it to the outside next time? Everything else about it is great.
customer_reviews.author: KCR

customer_reviews.title: Recommend a pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Upon setting up the table per the instructions, found it to be uneven and with a bad wobble. Thinking the surface was not level, measured the length of each leg and found one to be 3/8" longer than the others - hence the wobble. I emailed Keter customer support with no response - even though was assured would receive a reply. My only option was either to try and return or remedy. I went ahead and removed plastic end piece of the one leg and ground down the aluminum leg tub the 3/8" so that all are now equal. Wobble gone. Clearly there is a problem with quality control with this item so would recommend passing and finding another option.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Prom

customer_reviews.title: A Very Sturdy Work Surface
customer_reviews.text: I worked construction for over 35 years and worked for high end contractors that didn't skimp on tools. I hate cheep tools that are low quality. These portable bench's are really designed well and after ordering one to see what they were like I ordered another. They carry well when folded and fold up and back well. One caveat is when folded the legs are retained quite loosely and seem maybe a bit fragile. Honestly, if they stay like they are for over a year of hard use I'll be happy and just buy another pair if they do break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pooly design table- Uneven legs and Handle breaks
customer_reviews.text: Follow up review: There is a common weak point in this table. The handle that is used to open /fold the table breaks when used. Poorly designed handle was not solid inside at the attachment point. Keter needs to address this problem. As for the legs, their uneven and could cause an accident. This table is not stable! The legs are not the same size. Although it has a 5 year warranty, there is not a phone contact number found for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Workshop essential, just not adjustable height.
customer_reviews.text: This table works well as advertised. It was very simple to unpackage and immediately start using. I have not tried the included clamps yet. The only thing was that the legs are not adjustable. I had one of these tables previously with adjustable height, but did not read or research enough to find that it was not adjustable (just assumed). It's not a deal-breaker, but would have been nice additional feature to be able to use as assembly table as well as outfeed for table saw. It is very stable and flat enough for my purposes. There is a lip all the way around that allows clamping of work pieces for assembly or cutting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Keter - Specializing in Wobbly Tables
customer_reviews.text: This is the second table in a row that I've received that is wobbly (legs aren't the same length). Other than that it's an ok table. Legs are not strong as others have mentioned. My first one also broke in one of the legs. I'm going to try this order one more time. After that, mark it up as a defect that is probably being produced by the hundreds or thousands.
customer_reviews.author: Alecksa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and portable work bench!
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor across the street has had one of these for years and always raves about it, so I finally bit the bullet and decided to get one for myself. As I was hoping, this thing is super easy to use, carry around and then store away! The 2 clamps that come with it are not too bad either for the average DIYer. No issues opening or closing things so far like some others have mentioned. If they do happen in the future, I’ll update this review accordingly. For now, you just can’t beat the price for a great work bench!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Klaban

customer_reviews.title: Get it while on sale
customer_reviews.text: When this bench went on sale, I bought 2. One is used for projects and the other serves as a table for a jigsaw and belt sander. The table is surprisingly sturdy, well built and the metal clamps are easy on and off. Out of the box: don’t touch the legs as they are already attached, grab two tabs and a fully formed table pops into shape. Make the “YELLOW SAFE TAB” pop into place by forcing the center divider to it’s position.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Mars

customer_reviews.title: Good design, bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to open the box and try it, it’s a great design, really cleaner for maybe DYI stuff at home, however it’s wobbly and everything but sturdy, legs don’t stay folded so you have to tape them or something, I got excited reading all the nice reviews about it, but again it’s cheap .. you pay what you pay for! Well maybe you pay little more then what you get this time! I might keep it in the storage , or might box it, lable it, and return it when I have the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Handy, but the Legs are a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, folds up well, seems very stable. The legs are the problem. Then don't snap in place so they are loose a little and makes it difficult to store and carry. I kept bumping into things with the legs sticking out a bit. I can't imagine how this would hold up being tossed in a truck etc. The legs are a real problem. Also concerning is the plastic sides that hold it up. Doesn't seem it sill hold up well. I want something more sturdy and that locks away. I had to return sadly, but am ordering the Worx Pegasus after much looking.
customer_reviews.author: Piglet

customer_reviews.title: Value option - and will be fine for what we got it for
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find this product, as it solves a problem with have - having an expensive worktable that isn't up and out all the time. And once I got, and trying to set it up - I broke it. The manual is locked inside the folded up table, so there is nothing documenting how to open it. And, apparently I wasn't smart enough to figure it out on my own. It is a bit awkward to get it open and setup and put away, but once all that is properly done, it is solid, the clamps will get the job done and it is exactly what we were hoping for - at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: Great table, lousy repackaging job
customer_reviews.text: I love the table, even though it arrived with a corner damaged and it was “repackaged.” NOTHING makes me angrier than receiving repackaged goods. Especially when the item stinks of cigarettes and has damage because the morons who repackaged it were not smart enough to pad the corners. The foam was INSIDE the table where it does no good. Nothing on the corners. Freakin starting to dislike Amazon service. This is the second repacked shipment and the other also stank of cigarettes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: Kinda disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Came jammed together where plastic wrapping was jammed into the hinges as well as a plastic leg cap completely missing. So it doesn't stand level and rocks a little. Really wish there was a way of getting replacement parts that i was robbed of. Which after contacting Keter, i still dont have all the parts!
customer_reviews.author: Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of uses... Sturdy.  Doesn't seem to be cheap.
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy. The price was right. It folds up very small for storage. I'm very happy with this product. I watched several videos of this one and the WORXs table and went with this one because of price. If I run into any issues I will update here. I use this every weekend. Only con I can think of is when you fold it up one of the legs doesn't fold in all the way. It does PUSH in fine though so for storage sake it's still a win and this is why I didn't remove a star for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Bee

customer_reviews.title: Nice table horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table, one rubber feet for the legs is missing, i contacted 3 times customer service, and still waiting for a response from keter
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Broken right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Came broken. I thought I heard a rattle in the box, sure enough, a plastic pin fell out of one of the legs. Would not open. I put it back in the box and returned. I should not have to fix something BEFORE using it. I sent it back and ordered a WORX Pegasus.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Good Table, not Great.
customer_reviews.text: So it was wobbly from the gitgo... I put a couple of furniture pads on the bottom of two legs and the problem seems to have been solved. Is this the best you can buy? Not by a long shot. But for the money and for what I need it for, it will fit the bill. Fairly sturdy, but cheap plastic. Easy to assemble and take down. Fairly lightweight. Sure, if you’re not a bonafide shop sort of person, I would say this would be fine, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MPK

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had looked at the height and compared to other tables (ie. Worx Pegasus). I am short (5'4"), and this table standing at 30" is ridiculous. The Pegasus is 32", and my solid workbench is 33". I cannot believe the design team for this product overlooked this critical dimension. Otherwise, it seems to be very well designed. I expect I will decide to return it, and get one that's a little taller.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the outstanding reviews and the “1000 lb” weight rating. One day with about 125 lb on the table BOTH legs on one end just snapped - the flimsy plastic hinges just broke. Hard to believe the ratings on this piece of junk. Of course it was after the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Caddis

customer_reviews.title: A work-horse of a work-bench
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant workbench. It weighs around 20lbs and folds flat to around 4-inches depth. It opens really easily and provides a really firm base to cut things on. The bench came with a couple of clamps which were OK - but not as good as the De-Walt trigger clamps I have, so I still use those. The only possible criticism I could make is that - because this is made of plastic, if you're cutting something with a Jig-Saw it's really easy to cut into the top of the workbench. I should probably take more care - duh!
customer_reviews.author: Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I've read some reviews about the clamps breaking. Not sure what those peoples expectations were as these are plastic clamps. Use them for holding things in place and they work fine. If you overload them, then of course they would break. And don't over-tighten them. But those are the clamps, not the work bench. The bench has been great for many projects around the property. Easy to move anywhere and setup. Simple to fold down. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Escape13

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say good enough things about this table or explain how much I love it. I have placed heavy tools on it, holds them great, has not fall or collapse no even once. I'm always misplacing pens, drill bits, and screws, this table keeps me organize when doing a project. It is so light weighted, easy yo put away, and does not take any space in my garage. I was working with some lumber pieces, the table got so dusty, I took it outside, rinse it out with garden hose, and still going perfect, no rust, no issues, no stiffness. I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Giancarlo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Opened box and table is up in less than a minute. The 2 clamps are an added bonus which is designed to fully attach in place. Overall, I am happy with this. Fully recommended this item. Beware, same item with videos and is exactly the same is popping up in Facebook for $21. Ordered it hoping for a nice deal, PayPal took the money and no shipping or tracking whatsoever. Dispute ongoing, so do yourself a favor, get it here at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: STabs

customer_reviews.title: A table so sturdy, you could film BBW on it!
customer_reviews.text: I work on guitars in a small, one bedroom apartment, and this table is my go-to workstation. I love this thing. It's sturdy as hell, the included stowable clamps are a godsend, and it takes up very little valuable space when folded up. THE ONLY negative thing I would say is that when folded up, the legs have some play in them, so they don't stay closed 100% flush. For me, this isn't an issue since I don't travel with it, but for anybody that intends on carrying it around, be aware that the legs could potentially snag on something while carrying. Still, I highly recommend this table.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I've ever bought. First it's portable fits in trunks back seats. Second it's easy to set up. Third it's easy to break down and put it back in the car take it with you anywhere. I work on computers and I need a portable desk this thing works perfect. Then I can take it out in the back and use it for just about anything. Fantastic product I highly recommend that everybody have at least one of these in their house. Great engineering on this device. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great portable work surface
customer_reviews.text: First impression was horrible one of the clips that hold the table closed was not properly installed. A little hammer and block action set the clip into proper position. After that it folds and set ups easily. Sturdy and quick set up table. I enjoy the clamps however as expected they are a struggle to get in and out of the built in storage, but it’s better a struggle and easily lost IMO. Not too heavy to carry around but doesn’t feel weak while using it. I’ve used it several times once for cutting some sheets of plywood and it was solid.
customer_reviews.author: Chan1689

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.text: Assembles with the push of a button. Sturdy. Supports a good 200lbs. with ease ( I laid across the table plank-style flat-out and wasn’t worried the bench would fall.) Buy it it’s worth the 80$ for both strength and ease of use plus the pure usefulness. If you work with wood or pvc or just need a tough piece of equipment that allows you to safely use use and house other equipment you found what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Leopoldo Farias III

customer_reviews.title: I viewed the video which I strongly recommend in order to grasp the operation of the table
customer_reviews.text: I viewed the video which I strongly recommend in order to grasp the operation of the table. It works as advertised and is a substantial and firm working platform....while exhibiting ease of opening and collapsing. My only bug a boo was the on board clamps.....I had to spend an hour or so getting them to operate as expected....I had lubricate them....run them in and out many times just to get them to work properly; however, they do now operate as expected. For the price, table is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W. Hill, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Light and Easy to set up.  Holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in the garage and find it easy to set up for any task. The two shelves allow it to hold a lot. I take it to the gun range to hold my ammo, etc. I use it for my router and other power tools. Great work table.
customer_reviews.author: mtnbilly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome work table
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a good work table for over a decade, and making do with sawhorses in the meantime. This table is exactly what I have been looking for. The folding mechanism is brilliant and I love being able to carry it to wherever I need to work, then dropping it open. It is super sturdy and easy to use with clamps. Highly recommended. One note - there have been some bad reviews due to people breaking the opening mechanism, but that wouldn't happen if they just follow directions and DON'T PULL ON THE LEGS!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Deserving of 5 stars. Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: Very rare for me to give 5 stars. But this is honestly one of the best buys I have made on Amazon. This workbench is simple to setup and take down and does exactly what it is supposed to do. Once assembled, it is rock solid. The clamps are easy to add once you take a moment to figure them out, and kudos to Keter for having a slot for storing them once you are done. I will be getting alot of projects done with this thing. And the price can't be beat. Buy it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: soflatechie

customer_reviews.title: Not what it seems
customer_reviews.text: This table arrived and I was happy to have it with my woodworking tools, unfortunately, the joy did not last long. The molding process has left this table skewed and wobbly. You have to put 20 pounds in the center to get it to quit wobbling like a restaurant table you have to put sugar packs under. I am not impressed with the manufacturing of this product and will return for refund. This might have made a good addition to my tools if it were a little sturdier and taller. I am 5'10 and have to bend over to use which would result in back strain if using for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Table comes up a little short...
customer_reviews.text: I mean if you’re under 5’9” then this table will suit you fine. However, at 6’5” this thing puts a serious kink in my back! Absolutely workable for most around-the-house projects—but wouldn’t want it if I was a career carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: LokalX

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle, :( otherwise solid. clever design.
customer_reviews.text: The table itself seems to be solid and cleverly designed, but following the instructions provided, after the first time opening and closing the table, I noticed the piece of plastic securing the handle is broken off, rendering the handle useless. Perhaps it was damaged in shipping? It should not affect the overall functionality of the table but make moving it around rather inconvenient. I would be happy to receive a replacement table or perhaps just a replacement center support (which also houses the handle) but the apparent delicate design of the handle is still concerning. I will change this review to 5 stars when I receive a functional replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, product was not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I would really like to rate this higher except my bench arrived damaged. The side has a small crack and bottom table has a piece that fell off from another crack. I will still use and like the general idea of the table, just wish my product was not damaged. May have happened during shipping, not sure. The plastic is very hard and I am guessing the left side must have been dropped causing the cracks. I need the table for a job I am doing so will not be going through trouble of returning. I like the idea it is portable. If was not damaged I would rate much higher.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY B

customer_reviews.title: This is a poorly constructed tabled
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was dead on arrival. Parts were broken off and rattling around inside the shipping box. I returned it asking for a replacement. The replacement has a broken handle, but is useable so I kept it. Upon examining the handle, it could never have lasted very long because it has to lift the full weight of the table, but depends on a 1/4 inch diameter piece of plastic that is of poor quality. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: I've used this as a work table and stood on it a couple of times so far, and I'm not a small man. My only minor quibble is with how the legs kind of flop out from the side when it's folded up. I may add some sort of bungee cord to hold them in place, but it would be nice if this was accounted for by the designers. Still, a very capable product for the price. I love how the clamps store in the bottom shelf and work well with the grooves on the work surface.
customer_reviews.author: CDBSB

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Live Without it?! Collapsing Is Awkward.
customer_reviews.text: The Keter Workbench is one of those rare products that you wonder how did you live without one. Outdoor or indoor use it cuts work time and aggravation. The Keter Workbench is well thought out with a feel of quality throughout. Sturdy and sure-footed are the key words. What review would be complete absent some form of criticism? So here it is: Opening the workbench is a breeze and intuitive. However, collapsing the bench is another matter - it is an awkward and cumbersome procedure. Perhaps after much practice collapsing the workbench it will become as second-nature as setup.
customer_reviews.author: Physics Teacher

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my boyfriend who is a woodworker and he raves about this product. He compared to products in the big box stores and this item was cheaper by quite a bit. The design makes this so easy to use. Just a push of a button and you are ready to go. Will update later is anything changes
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a great work bench. This bench is easy to set up (click in the buttons and that is about it). It is nice that it comes with two vice grip clamps that are detachable. I do not do a lot of DIY projects so I can't speak to the maximum weight limit, but it has easily held everything I have needed it for. The breakdown of the bench is just as easy (fold in the sides and pick it up). It has a handle on the top so that you can easily pick it up and carry it where you need it.
customer_reviews.author: saltysam

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed with My Power Mitre Saw
customer_reviews.text: I checked the size of the top surface before I ordered it, to see that it fit my power mitre saw, because I had some household projects to do. A lot of wood cutting. When I got it it seemed even larger than I expected. It was perfect for my work. The tricky opening and folding mechanism is a wonder of mechanical engineering. I had fun with that one. The only drawback is the legs are a little wobbly side to side, but it didn't seem to affect what I was doing. It is also the perfect height for my average height. Folding so flat, it stows away even in my overstuffed garage.
customer_reviews.author: jtkat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box and started to use that day - nice size - super easy to set up - actually as easy as the product video - that is rare. Had it out in the rain - had 5 2x4's stacked on it - no problem. The clamps are a little meh, but that is the only thing I can say that is not great about it. After use - clean up and tear down - quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I only work on small, occasional projects, so this work bench does well. I haven't try to attach a power surge multi outlet to it but at first glance I can't see how unless I leave the bench open, which defeat the purpose of been to storage it away to safe space. I'm only 55'10" but I wish the leg could be adjustable or extendable another 6", to bring the table up at a maybe more comfortable working level.
customer_reviews.author: SFC Nieves

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING DEAL, TOP NOTCH QUALITY & SO EASY TO SET UP
customer_reviews.text: This workbench/table is pretty freakin amazing & it’s such a good deal! It really is sturdy, very well made & pretty much sets itself up in seconds. Very pleased with this purchase & HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Marina M

customer_reviews.title: Bench solid, clamps iffy.
customer_reviews.text: Workbench itself seems pretty good. Big improvement over plywood on sawhorses based on the one project I have executed since I got it. Easy enough to setup and tear down. Stable enough as well. If I have a complaint, it would be the clamps. They do not work very smoothly. I have other similar clamps that work MUCH better. Trying to slide them all the way back to store them in the workbench was more challenging than I expected. And one of the little rods that slide into the worktop tracks came off the first use. I am guessing it will eventually disappear altogether at some inconvenient time. Probably more of a 3.5 than a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great for a DIY woodworker/hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and easy to open up when needed. Lightweight and feels very sturdy. The clamps that come with it are a plus and useful. The only gripe I have with it so far (thus the 4 stars) is when folding it back up, the clamps at times will come loose a little. This prevents the legs from folding all the way down and you need to flip it back to reseat the clamps.
customer_reviews.author: primecustomer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the legs are stowed properly when you take it down.
customer_reviews.text: Just follow the follow the directions on closing so the legs fold properly. Other than that it’s great. I’m an Electrical Contractor, when working on a Service or Meter Can , just pop it open, set the brace and you have a great work table where you need it! When done, pop the brace and draw the bottom piece up and it folds right up! Wish I’d found out about it years ago, saves so much stooping. In snow, keeps stuff dry and visible!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C. Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic. No customer service. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this table for about 4 years now and it's failed me too many times. Pros: easy to assemble, takes up little space when stored, comes with clamps Cons: handle broke within 2 months, clamps are cheap plastic and break with moderate tension, table is not sturdy, legs dont stay closed, customer service is non-existent (wont respond to any messages or emails)
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for storage in my garage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for storage in my garage. I had a 6' chest freezer that I used for minor cutting, etc. but it died and had nowhere to do fixing. This is great. It folds like a folding table and lays flat against a wall...well out of the way. It is a bit on the heavy side, but I wouldn't expect it to be light. I didn't discover the setup instructions until I figured out how to open it up...they were buried inside the unit. Once I did set it up, it i quite sturdy and is as advertised. For the ltd. 2 year warranty, they told me that I merely needed to have a bill copy available.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This is awesome! Must buy!!!! 12+ STARS
customer_reviews.text: What an ingenious design! Two thumbs to release this light weight beast and you have a work space in less than 2 seconds! Two tiers, 4 legs pop open like magic, close middle support, now you’re ready to work! 1000 pound capacity!!! All done? Fold middle support, grab lower shelf, lift, and everything retracts back to original position. I suffer, like many, with not much space to do a zillion jobs. These jobs, using this awesome, compact, surprisingly strong and mostly super compact work bench make everything so much better!
customer_reviews.author: A. Tubolino

customer_reviews.title: You can not contact customer service if there is an issue
customer_reviews.text: I used product on two occasions for light molding work The third time I went to open it and the leg fell off I would be willing to purchase a new leg but after three days of emailing, calling and texting I am convinced there is no customer service for this product 😡
customer_reviews.author: tom lane

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily for its compactness and the extra storage area on the table. I didn’t really need the clamping features, but they are occasionally useful. I’ve had a lot of weight on this guy and it works well, maybe not 1000lbs but 500lbs should be safe. One minor complaint - the legs come out a little while the table is collapsed, (when legs are tilted down). Not a problem for me, but maybe for others.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend it all att
customer_reviews.text: The bottom section, where they store the tool close to the long handle which you use to carry the table is very thin and easy to be broken, mine last for a only a few times of using it. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Red Fox

customer_reviews.title: holding up and working well, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Had the table for four years now and have been very pleased. Not the greatest table for work that needs clamping to a solid surface but as a utility table it works well. Fold it carefully to prevent stress on the leg joints. One of the legs broke recently, snapped at the hinge. I called Keter and within one week I received two new legs in the mail at no charge. 10 stars for standing behind their product even when they know it is out of warranty!
customer_reviews.author: John in NH

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: This table is the bee’s knees!! Comes with a couple clamps and breaks down into a compact/light carry-along... I modified a Husky cart so that I can hang it on the side and use it for “high-profile” jobs for extended table space (when you can’t afford to replace the table on the room)... it will constantly be on the job-site or in the work van with me so I am getting another one for the house! Super stoked on this buy because I was on the fence with another more expensive table and this one has far surpassed my expectations of what I was paying for!
customer_reviews.author: WhomAmI

customer_reviews.title: Good and Handy
customer_reviews.text: Very handy table. Like the integrated clamps. Folds down nicely and is very portable. Unfortunately, I've cut a nice channel in the top, lengthwise, by not paying attention to what I was doing with my circular saw. Doesn't affect the utility of the table at all, just pisses me off that I was stupid. Great for taking out to the driveway or backyard where you can make a mess with sawdust and not worry about cleanup. I've left it out in the rain more than a few times and there's no sign of rust on any of the metal parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Built My Hotrod

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup with one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This table opens and closes in a snap. Once open it feels solid. I feel like I could put anything on it. The two clamps that come with it work great and feel like a bonus. The only down side is that it's hard to get it to sit level. And although solid it shimmys around a bit so task like sanding require a bit of pressure to hold it steady.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great till the legs gave out
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this work station till I stood on it (I'm 6'1" and 200lbs) It held for a while then suddenly the legs gave out. The plastic knuckle broke and rendered it useless. It said it can handle 1000 lbs. Only 800lbs. off. All legs were locked in place and I was on level cement floor. Not sure why 20% of its capability would destroy it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JJS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent work table
customer_reviews.text: This table works perfect for my application. I needed a table for my miter saw and this fits the bill. Easy to set up and close. I wanted to give kudos to Keter customer service. One of the clamps was missing the pin that secures the clamp in the groove on the table. I didn't want to send it back for that so I contacted Keter customer service and they sent me a new clamp right away. It's nice to find a company that stands behind their product. Very pleased overall. I recommend this table for anyone looking for a portable work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: Great work table
customer_reviews.text: I needed a work table for my new table and miter saws. It was easy to open up. I'm a 73 year old woman and I have had no problems with it. It's very sturdy, yet easy to move around. A great value. I leave my table saw on it all the time. I love it and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Great, Portable Work Surface
customer_reviews.text: My electrician pulled his Keter out and was up and working on it within about 30 seconds - faster than I could set up my saw horses. This unit also has the ability to clamp horizontally or vertically. Somebody else commented that the unit could hold 1,000 pounds but the instructions say to not exceed 400 pounds. This reviewer was incorrect. The instructions say not to exceed 1,000 pounds or 400 kilograms for an extended period. This work table is sturdy and rugged.
customer_reviews.author: KAA / JKC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is the greatest work table! So easy to set up, take down and store. I purchased because we are doing some work around the house and wanted something that was quick to set up, could be moved around easily and didn't require a lot of storage space. It arrived in time to use while installing a new wall oven. I don't think we could have done the installation without it. We were able to place the oven on it while doing the wiring and then lift the oven just a few inches into the space. If you DIY you need this table!
customer_reviews.author: RockinMimi

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically to use with metal cutting saws because of the 2 clamps that are super easy to 'lock' the saw into the table. I am super happy with the performance. Now I don't use the table for anything else except my makita metal cutting saw. It unfolds very easy just like described. I will be ordering at least 2 more to use with that saw and adding 2x blocks doubled to the additional tables on either side of the saw mounted table asa portable metal cutting setup. Will add pictures of this later.
customer_reviews.author: Cross U

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is my second work bench so I use both to add more workable space. Once I fully figured out the versatility to use the clamps, this bench has become my best friend. I can work a full size door on edge in the clamps and no need for extra hands to help hold the product still. Others are putting knock-offs on the market at a much higher price but they are not as stable due to the folding leg design.
customer_reviews.author: Todd from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Light strong and fast setup and take down
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty intuitive for setting up and use. Not the best finish (plastic tags and threads) but highly functional and easy to transport. Ideal for DIY projects. The included clamps aren’t as smooth operating as any of my other clamps but they lock into the table and work after you figure them out. Yes I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: William Klein-pells

customer_reviews.title: This is a great table.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all around portable work table. It assembles and folds back up with very little effort. It is small enough to use in tight areas and it helps that now I don't have to just put my work tools on the floor. Thank you for a great little table. I wish I would have gotten this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: KBC

customer_reviews.title: Smart investment.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the best things we have in the garage. I have finished four small projects with the Keter workbench. Clean up is easy. After each project Just release the clips on each end and it will start to fold back into place. Release the clips and the Keter workbench starts to open, and with a small jerk it’s open and ready for your next project. It’s portable, so on nice days going out side is a breeze. It has proven to be a nice investment for us. I would recommend to everyone to buy. The Keter workbench has a lot of uses around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best portable workbench ever
customer_reviews.text: I used a very similar product (branded Black & Decker) for many years, and when it finally broke, I was delighted to find a replacement that was essentially the same product, exactly. This is one of the easiesst, more durable and strong portable work surfaces you'll ever use. An excellent bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lee

customer_reviews.title: MY KETER TABLE FELL APART WITH MINIMAL WEIGHT ON IT
customer_reviews.text: I used my Keter table a couple of times. I then used it to be one of two tables to layout boards for painting. There could not have been more than 75-100 pounds of weight on the Keter table. However, the legs buckled underneath and snapped off. The write up said this table could hold up to 1000 pounds. I feel I received a 'LEMON". I would like a new table or a refund on the money I spent for the table. Jerry Stone
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Table is great clamps are cheap and fragile.
customer_reviews.text: I love the table but one of the clamps broke. Clamps are very poorly made (and hence the 3 stars only) Basically you are buying a nice table for this price and be prepared to pay $20 to $30 for a pair of better built clamps to use with the table.
customer_reviews.author: cryptoman

customer_reviews.title: Broken plastic and not level
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke off one side on the second day. The is no metal reinforcement in the handle just plastic on the two ends. Also the legs don't exactly snap into place or completely stow tight and are not level on the floor when deployed. Other than all that it is the right size and the clamps are useful. I gave it a 3 instead of a 2 because I can work around the defects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to open a little harder to close, but still a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I liked not only the sturdiness, but the cost (which is far below many of the others on sale here), and it is perfect for me to use as a platform for my tabletop router (this is the table), and for my chop saw. I have used for many other things, but mainly it's my table for the other tools. It's a bit hard to get it to go all the way together but I think I'll probably get better at it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Great work bench
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup, very sturdy. I only wish it were about 6"-1' taller, but it really is nice to finally have a mini, travelling work space for my projects. Best of all, I really like the fact that it comes with 2 grips, super nice feature. Very pleased with this purchase, and good price on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rye

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy this Worktable!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I took it out of the box the legs were not all the same length and the table does not sit properly. Because it was after the return period I did not get any response from the seller. They should have fixed the problem anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great clamp table
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Put it right to use. Bonus was the clamps and ability to use it as a clamp table. I thought it was just a workbench but used it as a clamp table and workbench. Pops right up without tools or anything. Very strong. Best thing I have bought in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simonis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no customer service,
customer_reviews.text: Customer service worthless. One email saying I would get a call and it never came, 2 more emails from me and still no response, when it worked it was good, unfortunately after 3 uses one leg wouldn't close and broke very easily.
customer_reviews.author: MSRiverdog

customer_reviews.title: O how I love thee, let me count the ways!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this thing been all my life? 5 stars easy decision. The only thing you could wish for would be for a solid bottom (so you can clamp things downward from the top w/o another board) and the ability to hold two more clamps (cause i'm greedy). Otherwise this thing is crazy awesome. A friend of mine showed up with one over the weekend and I had mine the next week.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: I can’t recommend it enough! Best investment on my security ever
customer_reviews.text: I am a poor skilled craftgirl that love to do homework and crafts more often that I should, and having something that is a nice, effortless to set up, light weight to move and carry around and yet, so useful it’s priceless! It has significantly reduced my near accident count, because it’s so easy to handle and secure things on it, making my position better, reducing back pain when I embark on a craft mission, it has even improved my skills :) as now when I cut any wood come out a bit more straight :)
customer_reviews.author: Lina L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and handy- wish I had bought two
customer_reviews.text: Can not be beat for the right price. This is one tough portable work bench that brings a lot of capability. The clamping system is very handy and works well. It also makes for an excellent table for a power compound mitre saw. Whatever you do NEVER PULL THE LEGS OUT BY HAND when wanting to open the table- the directions are very plain in this area but it is a hard temptation to resist. Could stand to be a tad taller in height but that's a minor point, I just wish I had bought two.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Handy Table
customer_reviews.text: It's a handy table to have around, also acts as a giant step stool since it has a 1000# weight rating. That said, one leg is a little longer than the others, so its slightly wobbly. A little cardboard under the leg fixes this problem. I'm considering trying another to see if its just my copy. The clamps are good quality, enough for most things.
customer_reviews.author: M. Froom

product_meta.title: Keter Folding Table Work Bench for Miter Saw Stand, Woodworking Tools and Accessories with Included 12 Inch Wood Clamps – Easy Garage Storage
product_meta.description:
Pattern Name:Bench

Whether you're a contractor or a DIY enthusiast, the Folding Work Table by Keter provides a sturdy yet portable work space for a wide variety of projects. From home improvement projects to commercial construction work, this folding workbench helps you get the job done in any type of setting. Whether you need a sawhorse for cutting jobs or a place to rest boards for painting, a pair of one-handed clamps holds your project materials securely in place. Count on this folding work table to provide dependable work support for everything from sanding two-by-fours to staining table legs. Durable steel legs provide the support you need to feel confident while performing any task. Try it for one project and the bench will become your go-to source for reliable work support.

Thoughtful engineering, quality construction and weather-resistant materials allow the table to adapt well to any work environment. Made from rugged polypropylene resin, the work table is built to stand the test of time. Its plastic base offers the following benefits:

 * Won't peel
 * Resists cracking
 * Never rusts
 * Resistant to dents
 * Won't fade in the sun
 * Folded dimensions: 33.46” W x 21.65” D x 4.4” H
 * Assembled dimensions: 33.46” W x 21.65” D x 29.75” H



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Keter 17182239 Folding Work Table pops up to allow for a work surface then neatly folds away when you're done. Won't take up much room when not in use. Two clamps are included to hold down whatever you're working on. The quick opening device makes assembly a snap.
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: Standing: 33.46 in. L x 21.65 in. W x 29.75 in. H / Folded: 33.46 in. L x 21.65 in. W x 4.4 in. H
RESIN CONSTRUCTION: Made of heavy-duty resin with aluminum legs and a work space capacity of 1000 lbs.
DURABLE AND STRONG: Weather-resistant polypropylene construction prevents rusting, peeling, and denting
LESS THAN 30 SECOND SETUP: Unique quick opening and folding system for easy storage and portability
LESS THAN 30 LBS: With its lightweight design and sturdy carrying handle, take your workbench just about anywhere
EASY STORAGE: Folds down to 4.4 inches thick for easy storage in a pinch
ACCESSORIES INCLUDED: Includes two 12 inch clamps to secure a variety of working materials
VERSATILE USE: Perfect for any kind of project – DIY projects, home improvement, commercial construction work, painting, table saw use, and more

specifications.Included Components: 2- Removable Quick-Ratcheting, Keter 17182239 Folding Work Table
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,126 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
